intro: Barleria hirta, commonly known as red iron vine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually bright red or pink, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Barleria hirta is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and adaptability to various soil types.
